question: bag a contains red , white and blue marbles such that the red to white marble ratio is 1 : 3 and the white to blue marble ratio is 2 : 3 . bag b contains red and white marbles in the ratio of 1 : 4 . together , the two bags contain 36 white marbles . how many red marbles could be in bag a ?
if the average ( arithmetic mean ) of x , x + 2 , and x + 4 is 33 , what is the value of x ?
what is the greatest positive integer x such that 4 ^ x is a factor of 64 ^ 10 ?

machine a can process 6000 envelopes in 3 hours . machines b and c working together but independently can process the same number of envelopes in 2.5 hours . if machines a and c working together but independently process 3000 envelopes in 1 hour , then how many hours would it take machine b to process 9800 envelopes .
walking 4 / 3 of his usual rate , a boy reaches his school 4 min early . find his usual time to reach the school ?
if 2 x + y = 6 and x + 2 y = 5 , then ( x + y ) / 3 =
150 liters of a mixture of milk and water contains in the ratio 3 : 2 . how much water should now be added so that the ratio of milk and water becomes 3 : 4 ?
if the number is divided by 3 , it reduced by 30 . the number is

a plant manager must assign 6 new workers to one of five shifts . she needs a first , second , and third shift , and two alternate shifts . each of the shifts will receive 2 new workers . how many different ways can she assign the new workers ?
in a 100 m sprint race kelly was given a 3 m head start by abel . if abel lost the race to kelly by a distance of 0.50 m , how many meters more would abel need to overtake kelly ?
the mean of 30 values was 150 . it was detected on rechecking that one value 165 was wrongly copied as 135 for the computation of the mean . find the correct mean .

bookman purchased 55 copies of a new book released recently , 10 of which are hardback and sold for $ 20 each , and rest are paperback and sold for $ 10 each . if 14 copies were sold and the total value of the remaining books was 360 , how many paperback copies were sold ?

xavier , yvonne , and zelda each try independently to solve a problem . if their individual probabilities for success are 1 / 4 , 1 / 3 and 5 / 8 , respectively , what is the probability that xavier and yvonne , but not zelda , will solve the problem ?
how many positive integers less than 5,000 are evenly divisible by neither 16 nor 21 ?
how many integers from 1 to 100 exist such that each is divisible by 5 and also has 5 as a digit ?
if x , y , and z are positive integers and 2 x = 3 y = 4 z , then the least possible value of x + y + z is

an optometrist charges $ 150 per pair for soft contact lenses and $ 85 per pair for hard contact lenses . last week she sold 5 more pairs of soft lenses than hard lenses . if her total sales for pairs of contact lenses last week were $ 2,160 , what was the total number of pairs of contact lenses that she sold ?
the ratio of a to b to c is 2 to 3 to 4 , and a , b , c are positive integers . if the average ( arithmetic mean ) of the 3 numbers is 42 , what is the value of a ?
a , b and c play a cricket match . the ratio of the runs scored by them in the match is a : b = 4 : 3 and b : c = 4 : 5 . if the total runs scored by all of them are 75 , the runs scored by b are ?
the average age of a class of 22 students is 21 years . the average increased by 1 when the teacher ' s age also included . what is the age of the teacher ?
the sum of a certain number and its reciprocal is equal to 29 . what is the absolute value of the difference of this number and its reciprocal ?
if x = 6 ^ 36 and x ^ x = 6 ^ k , what is k ?
a customer went to a shop and paid a total of $ 30 , out of which $ 1.28 was for sales tax on taxable purchases . if the tax rate was 8 % , then what was the cost of the tax free items ?
find the numbers which are in the ratio 3 : 2 : 4 such that the sum of the first and the second added to the difference of the third and the second is 21 ?

in a particular state , 70 % of the counties received some rain on monday , and 55 % of the counties received some rain on tuesday . no rain fell either day in 35 % of the counties in the state . what percent of the counties received some rain on monday and tuesday ?
a and b complete a work in 16 days . a alone can do it in 40 days . if both together can do the work in how many days ?
b completes a work in 6 days . a alone can do it in 10 days . if both work together , the work can be completed in how many days ?
if a and b get profits of rs . 6000 and rs . 4000 respectively at the end of year the ratio of their investments are ?
a , b , c can do a piece of work in 20 days , 30 days and 40 days respectively , working alone . how soon can the work be done if a is assisted by b and c on alternate days ?
a circular logo is enlarged to fit the lid of a jar . the new diameter is 30 per cent larger than the original . by what percentage has the area of the logo increased ?
the mean of 50 observations was 36 . it was found later that an observation 58 was wrongly taken as 43 . the corrected new mean is ?
if 50 apprentices can finish a job in 4 hours , and 30 journeymen can finish the same job in 7 hours , how much of the job should be completed by 10 apprentices and 15 journeymen in one hour ?
40 % of a number is added to 120 , the result is the same number . find the number ?
the sum of the numbers is 177 . if the ratio between the first and the second be 5 : 3 and that between the second and third be 4 : 9 , then find the second number ?
what is the least value of x . so that 43 x 87 is divisible by 3 ?
jill invests $ 10000 in an account that pays an annual rate of 3.96 % , compounding semi - annually . approximately how much does she have in her account after two years ?
in town x , 60 percent of the population are employed , and 48 percent of the population are employed males . what percent of the employed people in town x are females ?

tom wants to buy items costing $ 25.35 , $ 70.69 , and $ 85.96 . he earns $ 6.50 an hour doing odd jobs . if ten percent of his income is put aside for other purposes , how many hours must he work to earn the money he needs for his purchases ? round your answer to the nearest whole hour .
what is the least number . which should be added to 0.0355 to make it a perfect square ?
85 % of a number is added to 24 , the result is the same number . find the number ?
if x = 3 ^ 27 and x ^ x = 3 ^ k , what is k ?
if x = 1 - 3 t and y = 2 t - 3 , then for what value of t does x = y ?
rs 3000 is divided into two parts such that one part is put out at 3 % and the other at 5 % . if the annual interest earned from both the investments be rs 144 , find the first part .

an uneducated retailer marks all his goods at 55 % above the cost price and thinking that he will still make 25 % profit , offers a discount of 25 % on the marked price . what is his actual profit on the sales ?
if 8 boys meet at a reunion and each boy shakes hands exactly once with each of the others , then what is the total number of handshakes
a factory produces 4560 toys per week . if the workers at this factory work 4 days a week and if these workers make the same number of toys everyday , how many toys are produced each day ?

for a particular american football game , the probability of a team ' s quarterback throwing a completed pass on each throw is 3 / 10 . what is the least number of times that the quarterback should throw the ball that will increase the probability of getting a completed pass at least once to more than 50 % .
if 60 % of ( x - y ) = 30 % of ( x + y ) then what percent of x is y ?
a 180 meter long train crosses a man standing on the platform in 9 sec . what is the speed of the train ?

the distance between 2 cities a and b is 1000 km . a train starts from a at 8 a . m . and travels towards b at 100 km / hr . another starts from b at 9 a . m . and travels towards a at 150 km / hr . at what time do they meet ?
